edu.internet2.middleware.grouper.pspng

Class FullSyncProvisioner

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.internet2.middleware.grouper.pspng.FullSyncProvisioner

  • public class FullSyncProvisioner
extends Object
    This class manages a full-sync thread for a provisioner. This is expected to be instantiated within the Grouper Loader/Daemon jvm and it reads from the grouper-loader settings, but it is not triggered by any changelog or message harness. Instead, full-refreshes are triggered via Quartz and the processing interacts directly with the Group registry.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        protected void start()
        Get the FullSync thread_manageFullSyncProcessing() thread running

      • thread_manageFullSyncProcessing

        protected void thread_manageFullSyncProcessing()
        method that manages full-sync processing. Most of the time you think of FullSync as what happens on a schedule (weekly full-sync, for example). However, sometimes incremental provisioning can need a specific group to be sanity checked. For example, if a +member change and a -member change are batched together, the desired order can be lost. Therefore, a full-sync of the group will make sure the result is accurate. This method will wait for any full-refreshes to be requested, either from incremental provisioning or from a quartz-scheduled thread that triggers all the groups to be sync'ed.

      • getNextGroupToFullSync

        protected FullSyncProvisioner.FullSyncQueueItem getNextGroupToFullSync()
        Go through the various full-sync queues and get the next GroupInfo object. This method blocks until a group is ready for full-syncing

      • queueAllGroupsForFullSync

        protected void queueAllGroupsForFullSync()
        Go through the Grouper Groups and queue up the ones that match the provisioner's ShouldBeProvisioned filter.

      • scheduleGroupForSync

        public void scheduleGroupForSync(GrouperGroupInfo grouperGroupInfo,
                        boolean asap)
        Put the given group in a queue for full syncing
        Parameters:
        asap: - Should this group be done before others that were queued with !asap?
        group -

      • scheduleGroupCleanup

        public void scheduleGroupCleanup()
        Put a GROUP_CLEANUP_MARKER into the full-sync schedule. This means that the target system will be checked for information about groups that either no longer exist or that are no longer selected to be provisioned to the system.
        Parameters:
        group -

      • processGroup

        protected void processGroup(GrouperGroupInfo grouperGroupInfo)
        Workhorse method that handles the FullSync of a specific group.
        Parameters:
        grouperGroupInfo - Group on which to do a Full Sync
        asap - Used to requeue the group in the case of an error
